t: Isaiah 7
Isaiah Sent to King Ahaz

Now*p it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that*i Rezin king of Syria and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to make*i war against it, but could not prevail against it.
And it was told to the house of David, saying, “Syria’s forces are deployed in Ephraim.” So his heart and the heart of his people were moved as the trees of the woods are moved with the wind.
Then*p the Lord*s said to Isaiah, “Go out now to meet Ahaz, you and Shear-Jashub your son, at the end of the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the highway to the Fuller’s Field,
and say to him: ‘Take heed, and be quiet; do not fear or be fainthearted for these two stubs of smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and the son of Remaliah.
Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have plotted evil against you, saying,
“Let us go up against Judah and trouble it, and let us make a gap in its wall for ourselves, and set a king over them, the son of Tabel”—
thus says the Lord God:*s “It*pn shall not stand, Nor*ld shall it come to pass.
For*ld the head of Syria is*i Damascus, And*ld the head of Damascus is*i Rezin. Within*ld sixty-five years Ephraim will be broken, So*ild that*i it*i will*i not be*i a people.
The*ld head of Ephraim is*i Samaria, And*ld the head of Samaria is*i Remaliah’s son. If*ld you will not believe, Surely*ld you shall not be established.”’”
The Immanuel Prophecy
Moreover*p the Lord*s spoke again to Ahaz, saying,
“Ask a sign for yourself from the Lord*s your God; ask it either in the depth or in the height above.”
But*p Ahaz said, “I will not ask, nor will I test the Lord!”*s
Then*p he said, “Hear now, O house of David! Is*i it*i a small thing for you to weary men, but will you weary my God also?
Therefore the Lord Himself will give you a sign: Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a Son, and shall call His name Immanuel.
Curds and honey He shall eat, that He may know to refuse the evil and choose the good.
For before the Child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land that you dread will be forsaken by both her kings.
The Lord*s will bring the king of Assyria upon you and your people and your father’s house—days that have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah.”
And*pn it shall come to pass in that day That*ild the Lord*s will whistle for the fly That*ld is*i in the farthest part of the rivers of Egypt, And*ld for the bee that is*i in the land of Assyria.
They*ld will come, and all of them will rest In*ld the desolate valleys and in the clefts of the rocks, And*ld on all thorns and in all pastures.
In*ln the same day the Lord will shave with a hired razor, With*ld those from beyond the River, with the king of Assyria, The*ld head and the hair of the legs, And*ld will also remove the beard.
It*ln shall be in that day That*ild a man will keep alive a young cow and two sheep;
So*ld it shall be, from the abundance of milk they give, That*ld he will eat curds; For*ld curds and honey everyone will eat who is left in the land.
It*ln shall happen in that day, That*ild wherever there could be a thousand vines Worth*ild a thousand shekels*i of silver, It*ld will be for briers and thorns.
With*ld arrows and bows men*i will come there, Because*ld all the land will become briers and thorns.
And*ln to any hill which could be dug with the hoe, You*ld will not go there for fear of briers and thorns; But*ld it will become a range for oxen And*ld a place for sheep to roam.
